title: 2 font requests. one similar to comic sans and other similar to freestyle (imho - just guessing)
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317202428im_/http:/typophile.com/files/tricolor%202%20(2)_4082.jpg)

needing to make wooden nameplates, so trying to stick as close to original font as possible.  
I am far from being a pro at this, so of course I be looking for something free to use.  
my humble guess of closeness is comic sans for the one and freestyle for the other, but neither is really close.  
already tried whatthefont, identifont, etc, got nothing even close.  
stumbled across here, and joined in the hopes someone knows what these are.  
Thanks very much in advance for any and all suggestions.  
 Thanks.

Font: 

 Segoe Print Bold / Honey Script 

Solved By: 

 [DPape](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317202428/http:/typophile.com/user/3945 "View user profile.")
author: murfjs

comments.content:
\_TRI-COLOR\_ did not find the match yet, but Filmotype Lucky is close [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/filmotype/lucky/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317202428/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/filmotype/lucky/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/filmotype/lucky/") also Flash [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/flash/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317202428/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/flash/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/flash/")  
Don

How about: Segoe Print Bold from Microsoft.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317202428im_/http:/typophile.com/files/tric1_5861.jpg)

Good find Dick. Bundled with Microsoft products. Always worth checking this source.  
Don

Thanks! for the help. turns out I didn't have the Segoe Print Bold - but I do now.  
and since I 'should' have had it, it made me look again for the 128th time and I figured out that "Photography" is Honey Script, which of course I already had but couldn't figure it out yesterday.

Apologies for posting something I should have been able to figure out on my own.  
But Sincere Thanks! for the assist. Greatly appreciated.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317202428im_/http:/typophile.com/files/test_3550.jpg)

for donshottype  
tried to credit both yourself and DPape in the solve box, but unfortunately the 'solve' area only allowed me to input one users name. So just wanted to drop a quick line to Thank You as well.
Thanks murfjs! from all of us for the closure... Dick Pape
